data.title: Musicians – South Wayne PorchFest
data.text:
Alexis Cunningham

A talented singer-songwriter who represented her native West Virginia in NBC’s America Song Contest. After relocating to Philadelphia, she has collaborated with Eric Bazillian of The Hooters, as well as Sweden’s iconic Niklas Strömstedt. For just a glimpse of her talent, give a listen to her song from America Song Contest Working on a Miracle?

Lauren Mendelsohn

Lauren is a talented singer-songwriter and performer from Bryn Mawr, PA, signed to Winding Way Records in 2022. Whether it's originals or cover songs, Lauren’s sultry and evocative voice stirs heart-felt emotion in her lyrics, conveying the ups and downs of life. Joining Lauren on the stage (porch) will be Jack Mendelson on guitar and Ed McNellis on keyboard.

Matt Rosato

A Paoli native and now residing in Massachusetts, Matt Rosato is an acoustic guitarist, as well as a singer-songwriter who performs songs from the classic rock to today. Catch a terrific sample of this very talented multi-instrumentalist and vocalist.

Minerva

Minerva is a 6-piece band whose original music delivers messages of hope embedded in emotionally driven rock. Much like their namesake, the lead singers of Minerva combine both their passion for music with a desire to inspire and heal others. As a cover band, Minerva pay tribute to some of our favorite artists such as Pat Benatar, Doobie Brothers, Elvis Costello, Alicia Keys and more.

M/C Project

Mark T Alberici is a producer, songwriter, recording artist and guitarist from Philadelphia. As a lead guitarist, Mark has performed with Robert Hazzard and the Heroes, Paragon, Storyteller, and PathToZen Garden and is now currently recording with his new projects The Oversizedgroove and live band The M/C project. His music is available on Spotify, Amazon Music,YouTube, Apple Music etc. Vocalist Cynthia Bagola brings her soulful bluesy voice to every note. She can also be found singing in a Jerry Garcia Tribute Band. Mark and Cynthia formed the M/C Project to support each other’s original compositions.

Jay Carlis & The Barrel Fires

Catchy original Americana rock tunes with beautiful male/female harmonies and lyrics that dig deep below the surface. The bands' sound and songwriting is inspired by Jason Isbell, Josh Ritter, Drive-by-Truckers and His Golden Messenger. Jay has released two solo albums and the band has released two EPS, all available on all the streaming platforms.

Fairmount String Quartet

Described as “likable and warmhearted” by the Philadelphia Inquirer, and “expert to the point of perfection” by the Chestnut Hill Local, the Fairmount String Quartet is dedicated to bringing the intimacy and vitality of chamber music to diverse audiences and is committed to performing classical works of historically under-performed composers in addition to those in the standard classical repertoire, works by women composers, and works in diverse genres including pop, jazz, folk, and Latin music.

TC3

TC3 is an acoustic trio which puts its spin on Americana, Folk and even some Classic Rock tunes in addition to original music written by Terri Camilari Making their mark on familiar tunes is what they provide using Guitar, Ukulele and Violin, strong vocals and new but intriguing arrangements.

The Baldwin B-Flats

The B-Flats are a competitive, auditioned a cappella ensemble from The Baldwin School. In Bryn Mawr. They sing a variety of musical styles, including pop, music theater, classical, and contemporary choral works. The group gigs regularly and is involved in a music exchange program with Ordrup Gymnasium from Denmark. In addition to singing as a select ensemble, each of the members of the B-Flats is also a part of the Baldwin School Chorus. They are under the direction of Lee Hagon-Kerr, the Upper School choral director at Baldwin.

The Larks

The Larks, founded in 1961, and the longest running outreach program of the Junior League of Philadelphia, is an a cappella group of volunteer women. From September to June, they perform throughout the Delaware Valley at a variety of venues.

Philadelphia Main Line Ukulele Group

Philadelphia Main Line Ukulele Meetup Group is a free jam group that promotes ukulele playing, activities, and music education. We hold online and in-person events. Our repertoire is eclectic and includes pop music from many eras and styles. Join us! We love new players. The ukulele is a very approachable instrument. They say you can’t be unhappy while playing a ukulele! It’s true!

St. Katharine's Children's Choir

Parishioners from grades 1 through 8 lend their voices to St. Katharine's Children's Choir. Under the direction of Stephanie Twohig and accompanist Laura Kerr, the Children's Choir leads the music twice per month at the Sunday, 9:30 a.m. Family Mass.

Happy Little Train Wreck

Happy Little Train Wreck has been playing music together for over 13 years now. Representing three generations of musical influence. In that time we’ve tried to put our spin on all genres of music, Polka to Punk. Primarily with two acoustic guitars and an upright bass creating the bed for beautiful vocals.

Rob Tait

Whether he's serenading from behind the drums or the guitar, Rob Tait's Americana // folk-pop style can mend the ache of a broken heart or make you stomp and holler until your shoes fall off. Born and raised in the pine barrens of New Jersey, Rob Tait's music combines his Americana/folk/singer-songwriter vocal style with his deep-rooted love and education of rhythm and the drums. Featuring mostly original music, Rob's band features guitar, pedal steel, bass, and drums, and vocal harmonies. Rob and his band are incredibly excited to be a part of South Wayne PorchFest for the very first time.

Rick's Office Band

Rick's Office Band is a Classic and Blues Rock Band playing covers from the last 5 decades. Our music focuses on vocal harmonies and melodic guitar leads. Our music covers music by Fleetwood Mac, Tom Petty, Lynyrd Sknyrd, and many more. We have been playing the Chester County area for the last 6 years and we are thrilled to make our 4th visit to the South Wayne Porchfest.

Rebecca & The City

Rebecca & the City was born in 2019 in the humble town of Manayunk, PA, where Rebecca (vox/guitar), Steve (keys), and Mark (drums/guitar) met on the Open Mic circuit. Since then, they've been performing their lovesick pop-rock bangers around the Philly area. Check out their music on Spotify and Youtube, with more recorded music planned for release around the end of the year. Follow @rebeccaandthecity on Instagram for the most up-to-date news on their live shows and new music.

Main Line Singers

We are the chorus of your community! Made up of your neighbors and friends, this new and growing group sings accompanied arrangements of upbeat tunes from Broadway, Hollywood and popular music, from Anything Goes to Hamilton to Frank Sinatra to Queen - and everything in between!

The Agnes Irwin Bel Cantos

The Bel Cantos are the a cappella ensemble from The Agnes Irwin Upper School. We perform music from all genres and styles - from the most contemporary to madrigals from the 16th century. We represent our school performing throughout the area at charity events, community functions, and choral festivals.

The Chaperones

The Chaperones are a rock trio based in Lower Merion. The group is fronted by the husband-and-wife team of Brian Richardson and Rebecca Raber and backed by their friend Curtis Zimmermann on drums. A cover band, the group taps into the history of rock by playing songs from the 1950s through the 2020s. Their repertoire includes tracks by the likes of Fleetwood Mac, the Talking Heads, the Pixies, Jenny Lewis and Taylor Swift.

The Shoeshiners

The Shoeshiners play an eclectic mix of bluesy Americana Roots Rock including some original songs. Songs feature acoustic and electric guitars driven by a Cajon drum with a lot of harmonica color thrown in. For a little spice we'll add in a banjo and an electric cigar box slide guitar.

The Stay at Home Band

The Stay At Home Band formed during the Covid pandemic in 2020. Our goal is to provide a little musical entertainment. We play Folk and old Rock & Pop. We have written and published a couple of songs. Hope you enjoy!

The Percolators

Smell the beignets! Taste the Jambalaya as The Percolators: New Orleans Style Party Band charges the atmosphere of PorchFest with passion, fire and soul! The Percolators is a Band that plays traditional and contemporary music from New Orleans and beyond. Our repertoire is drawn from: Jazz, Dixieland, Street Music, Rock and Roll, Blues, Rhythm and Blues, and Funk. Our mission is to infuse the Spirit of Mardis Gras, the greatest party on the planet, into any event we play. As we like to say, "Laissez le bon temps rouler!"

Karen Dekker & Hannah Rose

Karen Dekker & Hannah Rose are an exceptional violin/viola duo performing music ranging from Baroque to Contemporary. Hannah is the principal violist of the Philadelphia Ballet Orchestra and performs with the Chamber Orchestra of Philadelphia, Opera Philadelphia, and Philadelphia Orchestra. Hannah has been praised for her “rich tonal sonority”. Her orchestral solos have been noted as “exceptional” and “beautifully performed”. Hannah lives in Wayne. Karen lives in West Chester and regularly performs with ensembles such as New York Baroque Incorporated, Orchestra of Saint Luke’s, American Classical Orchestra, The Knights, Händel and Haydn Society, Philharmonia Baroque Orchestra, and several other ensembles in NYC and abroad. She is a member of Philadelphia’s Night Music Ensemble and Franklin Quartet and co-founder of chamber music series Listening in! in West Chester.

Jim Dougherty & Band

Jim is a songwriter and creative artist playing acoustic rock originals and covers. His soaring vocals and soulful blend of rock and Americana have hints of Eddie Vedder with a twist of Chris Stapleton. Over the course of his career he has been in the bands Bungi Orange, Five Mile Fall, and Kavalier, playing at the Warped Tour, Musikfest, and opening for other various national acts.

June Gail

June performs predominantly blues tunes, both covers, and originals composed by the keyboardist, Lisa Gail Murray. June (Alexandra June Murray) brings her wide vocal range and interpretation to favorites, some old and some new. Together, they have a great time, and hope you catch their blues fever.

Porch Poachers

Porch Poachers are from the Delaware Valley Fingerstyle Guitar Association. Their favorite music is anything that sounds good on a 6-string guitar fingerstyle - which means just about anything - Beatles to classical - folk to jazz standards - ragtime to country.

Zoe FitzGerald Carter

San Francisco Bay Area-based Folk and Americana singer-songwriter, Zoe FitzGerald Carter began playing guitar and singing as a teenager in Washington D.C. where her father was a well-known jazz drummer. In addition to her career as a writer, she’s played and performed with numerous local bands. Zoe's 2021 debut solo Waterlines was released to critical acclaim. Her new album Before The Machine is nothing short of an inspiring delight.

Dani Tapper

FOR KIDS AND PARENTS: Dani Tapper plays well known, classic sing-along songs on guitar/fiddle. Always a fun selection of songs for children of all ages as well as classic songs that mom and dad can sing along too.

Schrodinger's Cat

An eclectic mix of tunes from classic and contemporary rock, to jazz, blues, folk, funk, and Americana. Their music, always shaken, stirred, and with a twist, is sure to have you tapping your feet and singing along!

The Heartlights

A women's a cappella singing group whose mission is to bring music to those who might otherwise not have access to live music, primarily people in care facilities, or those who cannot leave their homes. Their repertoire consists primarily of pop music from the 1920's to the 1960's. Heart Light also have a few parodies. We enjoy including the audience in our sessions. A sample of our songs are: Some of the songs we sing are: 'I don't know why' 'We've got Grey Hair', 'God Bless America', 'Cohan Medley', 'Somewhere Over the Rainbow'.

Modern Yesterday

Modern Yesterday is a teen rock band from Philadelphia and Delaware County. They have been playing shows all over the PA, NJ, NY and DE area for several years. During 2022, Modern Yesterday released their first original single, "NO WAY OUT", which was played on radio stations in PA, NJ and in the UK, as well as placing in the Top 25 nationally in the Journey's Sad Summer Battle of the Bands competition. They were also the 2022 & 2023 winners of the Nazareth Academy Battle of the Bands Competition! Every member of Modern Yesterday is a multi-instrumentalist!

Fiddlechix

Do you just love different varieties of music played on the strings by talented musicians? Who doesn't! Presenting such a force - Fiddlechix! - On seven fiddles, a base, and a keyboard for some extra flavor, they play traditional fiddle tunes, folk favorites, bluegrass, swing, and show tunes. You will love them!

Charlie & Sons

Charlie and Sons is a ten piece, intergenerational combo. We honor our elders by energetically performing some of the best rock with horns tunes of all time. Represented bands include Chicago, Steely Dan & Bruce Springsteen & The E Street Band.

Work From Home

Rusty Rahmer and Sarah Charles bring their lovely harmonies and acoustic guitar to upbeat, popular covers from the 60’s to today. Each song is a delight for their audience.

David Lutken

David Lutken, the tremendously talented Broadway actor whose credits include Inherit The Wind and The Civil War will be bringing his unique blend of Americana and Bluegrass to us. In addition to his Broadway turns, Mr. Lutken won the Helen Hayes Award for Best Actor for his portrayal of Woody Guthrie in Woody Sez: the Life and Music of Woody Guthrie. This fall Mr. Lutken returns to People's Light Theatre in Malvern in the production of his play The Porch on Windy Hill. Mr. Lutken will perform a few tunes from his play, as well as some other folk, bluegrass, and Americana favorites.

Bach to Rock Bands

Talented musicians from the Bach to Rock music school. The Flood and Empire guarantee to entertain you with modern rock classics that will have you astounded at quality of music coming from these young talents.

Charlotte Morris

Growing up outside of Philadelphia, Charlotte Morris discovered her passion for music at a young age. After starting violin lessons at the age of 4, Charlotte taught herself how to play the guitar, piano (and melodica), ukulele, banjo, acoustic bass guitar and mandolin, and after all of that she began taking her songwriting seriously. She draws inspiration from female driven artists like Delta Rae, Brandi Carlile, Sara Bareilles, Kelsea Ballerini, Maren Morris, and The Chicks. After moving to Nashville, she released her 2nd studio album Wild Child, which took the industry by storm.

Wonder Hourse

A 7-piece folk-rock band with elements of soul, jam, Americana, and funk that captivates audiences with memorable hooks, four-part harmonies, and ethereal steel guitar solos. Their original songs touch on universal themes of friendship, love, and following your dreams, while the rhythms inspire fans to get wild on the dance floor.

ANALOG

The acoustic guitars and singing of Ed Lancaster and Peter Klinges traveling down the classic rock road from the Midnight Specials to Unplugged. Come hear and sing with the duo as they harmonize on some of your favorite songs from the 1960's into the 1990's.
